thread.title: Twitter gives the pope his own set of emoji
thread.title_full: Twitter gives the pope his own set of emoji

title: Twitter gives the pope his own set of emoji
text:
Pope Francis waves to the crowd upon his arrival in Santiago de Cuba. Santiago, the last stop on Pope Francis's Cuban tour, is known for its revolutionary history, its rum and the troubadours who have infused the Caribbean island's music with their tropical beats. (Photo: Filippo Monteforte, AFP/Getty Images)
1 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Ahead of Pope Francis' visit to the U.S. kicking off Tuesday, Twitter is rolling out a new series of emojis to help celebrate.
Users can tweet the following four hashtags to view the emojis: #PopeinUS, #PopeinDC, #PopeinNYC, #PopeinPhilly. Each drops in a small image such as Pope Francis in front of the U.S. flag, the U.S. Capitol, the Statue of Liberty and the Liberty Bell.
The pope joins a growing number of emojis Twitter rolled out in recent months, available through select hashtags. The company unveiled a series of emojis tied to Star Wars, and recently allowed brands to create their own emojis, starting with Twitter's partnership with Coke, as TechCrunch reports .
The pope arrives in the U.S. on Tuesday, and visits the White House on Wednesday.
Follow Brett Molina on Twitter: @brettmolina23 .
